# Chord: Major 7b5 in C# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Major 7b5 chord is a unique and sophisticated chord that can add depth and color to your music. Also known as a Major 7th flat 5 or augmented major 7th chord, it is characterized by the combination of a major 7th interval and a diminished 5th interval. In the key of C#, the Major 7b5 chord has the shape of a C chord and provides an interesting and jazzy sound when used in compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
The Major 7b5 chord in the key of C# consists of the following notes:
- C# (Root)
- E# (Third)
- G (Diminished Fifth)
- B# (Major Seventh)

The intervals within the chord are as follows:
- Root to Third: Major 3rd interval (E#)
- Root to Diminished Fifth: Diminished 5th interval (G)
- Root to Major Seventh: Major 7th interval (B#)
- Third to Diminished Fifth: Diminished 5th interval (G)
- Third to Major Seventh: Major 3rd interval (E#)
- Diminished Fifth to Major Seventh: Augmented 2nd interval (B#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 chord is commonly used in jazz and fusion genres to add complexity and sophistication to compositions. It has a rich and mysterious quality that can create tension and interest in music. When played in a sequence or progression, it can evoke a sense of longing, melancholy, or introspection. The chord's dissonant yet beautiful sound makes it a favorite among musicians looking to explore unconventional harmonies and textures in their music.
